Extract baseline expression information without fold change augmentation

extract_expression_info.Rd

This function extracts and processes baseline expression data for power analysis without adding fold change parameters. It handles pilot data loading, TPM filtering, and gene sampling. This is a modularized version of the first part of extract_fc_expression_info.

Usage

extract_expression_info(
  biological_system = "K562",
  B = 200,
  gene_list = NULL,
  TPM_threshold = 10,
  custom_pilot_data = NULL
)

Arguments

biological_system

Character. Biological system for baseline expression. Available options: "K562", "A549", "THP-1", "T_CD8", "iPSC" (default: "K562").

B

Integer. Number of Monte Carlo samples to generate when gene_list is NULL (default: 200). Ignored when gene_list is provided.

gene_list

Character vector. Optional list of Ensembl gene IDs to use for analysis. If provided, expression parameters will be extracted for ALL specified genes (no sampling). If NULL (default), B genes are randomly sampled from baseline data.

TPM_threshold

Numeric. Minimum TPM threshold (default: 10). Genes with expression levels below TPM_threshold/1e6 are filtered out before power calculation.

custom_pilot_data

List. Optional custom pilot data. If provided, this data is used instead of the default biological_system data. Must contain baseline_expression_stats (data frame with gene expression data) and library_parameters (with UMI_per_cell and variation).

Value

A list with elements:

expression_df

Data frame with baseline expression parameters (response_id, relative_expression, expression_size)

pilot_data

Complete pilot data object for further use

n_genes

Integer number of genes in the processed dataset

Details

The function operates in two modes:

  • Gene-specific mode (gene_list provided): Uses ALL specified genes with importance sampling

  • Random sampling mode (gene_list = NULL): Randomly samples B genes from baseline

Processing steps:

  1. Load pilot data (custom or from package)

  2. Apply TPM threshold filtering

  3. Sample genes according to specified mode

  4. Return baseline expression data ready for fold change augmentation

Examples

# Extract expression info from K562 system
expr_info <- extract_expression_info(
  biological_system = "K562",
  B = 100,
  TPM_threshold = 5
)
#> Error in extract_expression_info(biological_system = "K562", B = 100,     TPM_threshold = 5): could not find function "extract_expression_info"

# Examine the results
head(expr_info$expression_df)
#> Error: object 'expr_info' not found
print(paste("Extracted", expr_info$n_genes, "genes"))
#> Error: object 'expr_info' not found

# Use with custom gene list
gene_list <- c("ENSG00000141510", "ENSG00000157764", "ENSG00000175899")
custom_expr <- extract_expression_info(
  biological_system = "K562",
  gene_list = gene_list,
  TPM_threshold = 1
)
#> Error in extract_expression_info(biological_system = "K562", gene_list = gene_list,     TPM_threshold = 1): could not find function "extract_expression_info"

# Check expression levels
summary(custom_expr$expression_df$relative_expression)
#> Error: object 'custom_expr' not found
